folder: St. Marks Place & Forts Place, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: St. Marks Place - Forts Place
text:
302 St. Marks Place, adjoining the N.W. corner of Fort Place, showing the Staten Island Masonic Club. The house was owned by the Carrere family from 1898 to 1917 (see map of above years).
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr

folder: St. Marks Place & Fort Place, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: St. Marks Place - Fort Place
text:
St. Marks Place, west side, between Fort Place and Wall Street, showing the McKee Vocational High School. The view is north from Fort Place.
June 22, 1937
P. L. Sperr

folder: St. Marks Place & Fort Place, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: St. Marks Place - Fort Place
text:
St. Marks Place, at the S.W. corner of Fort Place, showing two views of the Brighton Heights Reformed Church. View 2 shows the Fort Place side of the edifice.
March 16, 1940
Views 1, 2
Gift of Albert Norman

folder: St. Marks Place & Fort Place, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: St. Marks Place - Fort Place
text:
St. Marks Place, at the S.W. corner of Fort Place, showing two views of the Brighton Heights Reformed Church. View 2 shows the Fort Place side of the edifice.
March 16, 1940
Views 1, 2
Gift of Albert Norman

folder: Fort Place & St. Marks Place, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: Fort Place - St. Marks Place
text:
Fort Place, adjoining the N.W. corner of St. Marks
Place.
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr

folder: St. Marks Place & Fort Place, Staten Island, NY
original_title: Richmond: St. Marks Place - Fort Place
text:
(1)
326 St. Marks Place, east side, at the head of Fort Place, showing the "Bella Vista,' built in the Norman-French style of architecture. The chateau was owned by Mrs. J. C. Thompson, in 1874; by Fred Tiedmann, in 1898; and by Richard Agar, in 1907.
May 28, 1927
P. L. Sperr

(2)
Another view, seen from Hyatt Street.
May 28, 1927
P. L. Sperr
